intro: Bupleurum leucocladum var. haussknechtii, commonly known as the white-flowered bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant thrives in well-drained soils in temperate climates. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
